title: osNFTs for science popularization
description: Scientific knowledge is often locked behind paywalls, in spite of it being mostly funded by the public. Science should be more accessible.

f6_assessments.q0: Addresses the challenge quite well in using the NFTs in a non-art way by potentially help funding future scientific research. The freedom for the public to view these papers will create extra traffic never before possible. Opening up new possibilities and introducing new people to blockchain and Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal has a dedicated and experienced team. Budget allocation and plan seems very reasonable. The timetable for project completion seems reasonable. Having the developers on your team and proof of their skills would help boost voter and CA confidence.
f6_assessments.q2: They have provided in great detail what needs to be done and how they will do it. A clear roadmap with milestones. They are solving a much needed problem and the solution they provide seems perfect.  For this project to scale and be resilient to future challenges or risks, you could ad a voting system for scientists to vote on how you would deal with these challenges.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem that this team are proposing to address is an excellent use case of NFTs on the Cardano block chain. This proposal directly meets the challenge by suggesting a problem that effects the entire scientific community (millions of people) and would be used in high volume.
Referencing my scientific background I can confidently say that the problem that this team are tackling is massive. If they are able to solve it, it will substantially grow Cardano's user-base, network-utility, network-value & ADA circulation... Not to mention, change the world for the better. This proposal gave me goosebumps.
f6_assessments.q1: I strongly agree that this proposal would be implemented successfully and bring huge value not only to Cardano but to the world. The team make me feel this confident because they have prepared such a thorough and well presented proposal which fits the brief exactly. The proposers are high level academics who have presented to us a long term vision and the steps they plan to take to get there. The project is broken down into achievable parts with a defined roadmap to work to. Once the proposed project is available to other scientists it will have a high chance of adoption because the problem it solves is one of the biggest in the field.
f6_assessments.q2: The authors of this proposal have presented the Catalyst Community a detailed budget of how they plan to utilise the funds in initial phases of this project. The roadmap put forward is quite detailed and outlines each phase and steps within. This will make it simple for the assessment of its progress. The team have put forward two statements by which they would define the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal's problem statement and solution addresses the objectives of the challenge which is to create a non-art cases business model for NFT. I believe with using NFT as the medium for academics and scientist to publish their work, it will make the resources accessible to everyone while protecting the author's copyright thus bringing in alot of new users and also provides value to the community. However, this proposal fails to provide information on how this project is able to scale to address future challenges. How do you propose on how and what will be done to tackle traffic load and database issues when millions of people starting to use the platform. Will this platform be open source or only exclusive to the team members?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provided information on the team members with relevant skills and experience to successfully implement the project. Budget breakdown are made clear to understand. The proposer offers realistic roadmap. Furthermore, this proposal describes the necessary resources needed to implement the project. However the proposer did not provide any future risks or challenges that they may face during the development and how will they navigate through the problems. What is your plan when facing an issue that requires additional funding? Also, can you explain how do you implement the 'pay-per-own' or 'pay-per-view' model when the data is easily viewed by the public in the blockchain. Explain in details what sort of mechanism used to implement the privacy mode for NFT. Another question on the 'pay-to-own' or 'pay-to-view' model, if the buyer buys the token of the of a academic or scientific paperwork and produce something out of it, will there any more charges or royalties that should be paid or does the smart contract is customizable for each of the token?
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a clear roadmap and direction of the project. However there is no reporting method provided by the proposers. Provide a way for the community to keep track of your progress for auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: This team wants to create an NFT open system for researchers to publish their papers and retain ownership of their work. This is a very interesting use-case for NFTs and a similar platform has not yet hit the market. This proposal directly addresses this challenge. A successful implementation would further help Cardano establish itself as a major blockchain organizer.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has created a detailed plan on how to approach this solution and has done a critical analysis of the business idea and considered some challenges that might arise on the way to market acceptance. The budget sounds very reasonable compared to the potential outcomes. Unfortunately, there is not much information about the technical implementation and also the two proposers do not provide us with references needed to implement this project (both technical and business). To better evaluate the feasibility and to see if the team will be able to implement the project, the implementation plan (technical and business) should be more detailed.
f6_assessments.q2: This team has a well-defined roadmap and the definition of success is made. But it would be even better to add some specific number related to the criteria (e.g. 1000 NFTs minted by scientists after 12 month). To improve this proposal, I recommend to link a documentation source to help to the community to assess the progress of this project. If the mentioned aspects are included, auditability would be much easier.

f6_assessments.q0: A very good usecase to NFTs that has identified a clear and real problem and intends to use Cardano NFTs as an solution to it.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is very extensive and the mixed experience of the team in the different required fields makes it very likely for them to be successful. The budget is realistic and defines each step.
f6_assessments.q2: With the detailed milestones and budget it should be quite possible to audit the progress and success of the proposal

solution: With osNFTs, researchers can publish, retain ownership of their work and distribute it to the general population in a marketable fashion.
experience:
Bioinformatics specialist. PhD-level.

Python, Javascript, big data, ML.

15 years in academia combined.

Post-doc level advisors.
